result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:32 AM Defendant Mark Denorta Mccoy appeared by video.  Attorney Adam Thomas Witt appeared by video for Mark Denorta Mccoy.  Attorney Corinne L Frutiger appeared by video for State of Wisconsin and Lafayette County District Attorneys Office. Special Prosecutor Lafayette County District Attorneys Office appeared by video. The defendant wishes to waive the preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause.  Defendant bound over for trial. The defendant wishes to enter a plea of not guilty. The Clerk is to enter the plea on the defendants behalf. Matter set over, bond continued.
Status conference scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
